error.noMembers: You haven't added any members to your DAO
error.noProposalModule: This DAO does not have a proposal module.

form.advancedVotingConfigDescription: Configure revoting, passing threshold, and quorum.
form.allowRevotingDescription: This will allow members to change their vote on proposals before the voting duration deadline. As a result, proposals will not be able to finish early.
form.automaticallyAddNFTsTooltip: Should NFTs sent to the DAO get added to the treasury?
form.automaticallyAddTokensTooltip: Should tokens sent to the DAO get added to the treasury?
form.governanceTokenBasedDescription: Fluid organization with many members who leave and join frequently. Members can join and leave by exchanging governance shares.
form.imageURLTooltip: A link an image. For example: https://moonphase.is/image.svg
form.membershipBasedDescription: Small organization with a few members who are likely to stick around. Members can be added and removed by a vote of existing members.
form.migrateDescription: This will <1>migrate</1> the selected contract to a new code ID.
form.name: Name
form.onlyMembersExecuteTooltip: If enabled, only members may execute passed proposals.
form.passingThresholdDescription: If your DAO has no quorum set, this is the percentage of the DAO's voting power that must vote 'yes' for a proposal to pass. For example, with a 50% passing threshold, half of the voting power must be in favor of a proposal to pass it. If your DAO has a quorum set, the passing threshold is only calculated from those who voted. For example, with a quorum of 50% and a passing threshold of 50%, a proposal could pass with only 25% of the total voting power having voted 'yes.' A majority passing threshold is recomended.
form.proposalDepositDescription: The number of governance tokens that must be deposited to create a proposal. Setting this may deter spam, but setting it too high may limit broad participation.
form.quorumDescription: The minumum percentage of voting power that must vote on a proposal for it to be considered. For example, in the US House of Representatives, 218 members must be present for a vote. If you have a DAO with many inactive members, setting this value too high may make it difficult to pass proposals.
form.refundFailedProposalsDescription: Should a failed proposal have its deposit refunded to the proposer? (Proposals that pass will always have their deposit returned). Turning this on, particularly when proposal deposits are high, may encourage members to deliberate with other members before creating a proposal.
form.refundFailedProposalsTooltip: Should failed proposals have their deposit refunded?
form.requireProposalDepositTooltip: If enabled, requires that tokens are deposited to create a proposal.
form.tierNameTooltip: The "class" of member. For example: "Core developers" or "friends and family." These names are only for your reference.
form.tierVotingWeightPrompt_membershipBased: Each member of this tier will receive {{weight}} voting power. Want to add members with different voting power? Add another tier.
form.tierVotingWeightPrompt_tokenBased: {{weight}} of the total token supply will be split evenly among all of the members in this tier. Want to add members with different voting power? Add another tier.
form.unstakingPeriodDescription: In order to vote, members must stake their tokens with the DAO. Members who would like to leave the DAO or trade their governance tokens must first unstake them. This setting configures how long members have to wait after unstaking their tokens for those tokens to become available. The longer you set this duration, the more sure you can be sure that people who register their tokens are keen to participate in your DAO's governance.
form.updateVotingConfigDescription: This will update the voting configuration for this DAO. A bad configuration can lock the DAO or create unexpected voting outcomes. Take care. If you have questions, please feel free to ask in the <2>DAO DAO Discord</2>.
form.votingDurationDescription: The amount of time proposals are open for voting. A low proposal duration may increase the speed at which your DAO can pass proposals. Setting the duration too low may make it diffcult for proposals to pass as voters will have limited time to vote. After this time elapses, the proposal will either pass or fail.

info.aboutToUnstake: You are about to unstake governance tokens
info.actionInBeta: This action is new and in beta. Double check the generated JSON before executing.
info.advancedQuorumDisabledConfigWarning: This is an advanced feature. If you disable quorum and set your threshold too high, you will need significant participation to pass proposals. A quorum allows a subset of members to pass proposals and can help prevent locking your DAO.
info.advancedVotingConfigWarning: These are advanced features. Threshold and quorum can interact in counterintuitive ways. If you configure them without fully understanding how they work, you can lock your DAO, making it impossible for proposals to pass.
info.autoCompoundStakingRewardsTooltip: This will automatically compound as staking rewards are distributed.
info.claimToReceiveUnstaked: Claim them to receive your unstaked tokens.
info.configureVotingDescription: Add members, configure voting thresholds, and (optionally) use governance tokens to determine voting share.
info.configureWalletModalExplanation:
You have Keplr installed, but it doesn't seem like you've set up a wallet. To continue, open the Keplr extension and set up a wallet.
To open the Keplr extension press the puzzle icon in the top right of your browser and then press the Keplr button. Once you've done that, a new page will open where you'll be able to create a new account. Configure your wallet to continue
info.connectWalletToViewUnstaking: Connect your wallet to view unstaking tokens.
info.connectWalletToViewVote: Connect your wallet to view your vote.
info.couldHaveMoreVotingPower: You could have more voting power.
info.daoPaused: The DAO is paused. Governance will resume in {{duration}}.
info.didNotCastVote: You didn't cast a vote when this proposal was open.
info.didNotVote: You did not vote on this proposal.
info.firstProposalPrompt: This DAO has no proposals. Why not create one?
info.haveNotCastVote: You have not yet cast a vote.
info.keplrModalWalletExplanation:
Your wallet is your digital identity on the blockchain. Having one lets you interact with web3 applications like DAO DAO.
We recommend the Keplr wallet.
info.mustHaveVotingPowerAtCreation: You must have voting power at the time of proposal creation to vote.
info.mustHaveVotingPowerAtCreationTooltip_clo: You were unable to vote on this proposal because you didn't have any voting power at the time of proposal creation.
info.mustHaveVotingPowerAtCreationTooltip_ope: You are unable to vote on this proposal because you didn't have any voting power at the time of proposal creation.
info.name: Name
info.noTokensUnstaking: You are not waiting for any tokens to unstake.
info.notAMemberYet: You are not a member yet.
info.openProposalsTooltip: These are open proposals you have not yet voted on for your favorited DAOs shown below.
info.preReleaseExplanation: This is a pre-release version of DAO DAO running on the {{chain}} chain.
info.proposalAllAbstainClarification: When all abstain, a proposal will fail
info.proposalQuorumTooltip: This proportion of voting power must vote on a proposal for it to pass.
info.proposalThresholdTooltip: A proposal must attain this proportion of 'Yes' votes to pass.
info.stakeToIncreaseVotingPower: Stake these to increase your voting power.
info.tierMemberGovTokenAllocationTooltip: This member will receive {{tokens}} ${{tokenSymbol}} when the DAO is created.
info.tos: DAO DAO TOOLING IS PROVIDED "AS IS", AT YOUR OWN RISK, AND WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND. No developer or entity involved in creating the DAO DAO UI or smart contracts will be liable for any claims or damages whatsoever associated with your use, inability to use, or your interaction with other users of DAO DAO tooling, including any direct, indirect, incidental, special, exemplary, punitive or consequential damages, or loss of profits, cryptocurrencies, tokens, or anything else of value.
info.treasuryBalanceDescription: {{numberOfTokensMinted, number}} tokens will be minted. {{memberPercent}} will be sent to members according to the distribution below. The remaining {{treasuryPercent}} will go to the DAO's treasury, where they can be distributed later via governance proposals.
info.unstakingMechanics: If you unstake now, it will take {{humanReadableTime}} until they are available to you. During that time, you will not recieve staking rewards. You will not be able to cancel the unbonding.
info.walletConnectMobileLimitations: Please feel free to explore the UI. Due to current limitations in WalletConnect, you will not be able to connect your mobile wallet to the {{chain}} chain.

splash.anyoneCanParticipate: Anyone from your community can be a full participant.
splash.easyToUseExplanation: No more command line wrangling just to vote on a proposal. DAO DAO'ss visual UI makes collective ownership accessible to everyone.
splash.longTagline: Simple, capable, and free DAO tooling. Built with love, by DAO DAO, on Juno.
splash.transparencyExplanation: Anyone can see what decisions your DAO made, and who voted for and against them.
splash.whatIsADaoExplanation: A DAO is an organization democratically controlled by its members.

success.daoCreatedPleaseWait: DAO created. You will be redirected once the DAO page is ready...

title.needWalletToContinue: You'll need a wallet to continue
